content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												This is my short and sweet look on the game Nether. Its a very nice game with a chance to meet new friends and have a thrill in the game. Nether is still a little undeveloped but I have faith in the developers in updating the game as time goes on. A game is a game where yu play it and you either enjoy it or not, I enjoy it. Its full of new thrills and exciting places to explore along with the challenge to survive against the monsters that come from the depths of Hell and the other players that are out to get you. Yes the game does have a few bugs but are currently being fixed on. For example, there used to be a large amount of ESP hackers giving some players the ability to obtain aimbot, teleport, invinsability, duplication, speed, and many more. The game was updated where the hackers were banned. Now half of the players that used to play (hacked) are now banned and the game is a lot more fun to play. I love to get on the game now and have fun with my tribe and friends. I recomend this game to anyone who is new to apocoliptic games. Its worth the $10!

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
Early Access Review
								If you enjoy a game where you stand no chance of survival unless you meet no human interaction then this gmae is deffinately for you. This game would be great if there was more PvE and a littel bit less PvP. See everyone in this game seems to think it is all about kill on sight and kill everyone on sight no matter who they are what they have or what they even know. Dont plan on lasting mroe than 5 minutes alive in the game or finding anyone to help you learn the controls or the mechanics and aspects. I have not run across many friendly helpful people and the few that i have are jsut so littel ammount they dont outweight the ammount fo player killing rude ones. If you enjoy a game where it is a real challenge to survive and fight against otehr but the elements cause no means of worry, this game might appeal to you. But if your looking for a Multiplayer RPG Survival game like the Genre is said to be this is not simply the case. A littel more PvE elements would be appreciated. Maybe even server options to turn off PvP. Or make there be less of a reward or even a penalty. I beleive it was meant to have a PvP element but not to the extent of not being able to trust anyone and being sniped the second you leave a safe zone.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												Well 30 mins in, died 3 times, its a fairly ok environment with safezones which you can spawn in with a machette, missions which spawn occasionally. A map with locations which you can waypoint to, to take on missions. Bugs, and monsters, 'nethers' for you to fight off with your butter knife ... an ultimately death .,.. Its a game which you learn through death ... i was losing interest due to the lack of scavenging ... i've looked everywhere and found squat.. on a server... not even an old gun without amo, a tin of beans. But when i played singleplayer I lucked out and found some good weapons fast, so there are probably different drop rates / settings between servers. There's a few servers, with a few people on them so its ok, i was thinking for the price to lan play it if nothing else ... Scavenging is hard and realistic.... The more you put into this game, the more you get out of it. For a buck worth a try i guess... and its just a case of learning the actual gameplay mechanics before losing interest.... then there is tons of content, just not some of the mechanics im used to being a 1000 hour arma 2 dayz vet. There is a single player campagn as well, you will find it at the top of the server list. Works ok, found Nether hoard almost straight away which was fun. Just played it again, quickly found a 'surging' hoard of Nether's ... when they surge .. its like they teleport in right next to you ... the fighting is realistic with realistic damage inflicted and recieved. Over time my health recovered. Killed a couple ... also found a bunch of weapons at the top of a building, in some metal crates ... Its panning out to be a lot of fun. will update as i put time in, but for a buck or even $5 not on sale its not a bad deal really

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								You´ll die, you´ll die and you´ll die again. Nether is all about trying to stay alive only to find out you fail in this quest eventually. Nethers can be avoided or killed - it´s the trickery of human mind that will snipe you down from a far, or hunt you down with a machine gun against your crowbar. It´s not bad, though, but the amount of your frustration will grow as you´ll progress with your character, gathering supplies, med kits, weapons and money, and suddenly you find yourself dead, not even knowing what put an end to your survival. This is not a TV show and you´re not a main protagonist - it´s harsh, it´s dangeours, but fun, if you´re that type of player. If not, you´ll turn this game off as soon as you die third time. Good thing is that noone can take away from you your account progress, and with playing the game you get various bonuses that are bound not to your character, but account as a whole. Graphics could be better and various customization of shadows, lighting or ambient occlusion are, in fact, useless. It´s the resolution and texture details what matters. Still, playing this game on 1600x900 with high details on 3 years old notebook graphics is a decent performance. In a cube: Nether is not a bad game, but not made for all kind of players, though. Fans of DayZ, horror and survival titles might be pleasantly surprised, others... frustrated.

												Nether is a awesome and fantastic world you can feel the environment and have a sense of feeling of being alone but you can just sense the enemy player or nether around the corner as you attempt to survive in this immerse world and helping your tribe expand like the roman empire and gain in wealth but at the same time other tribes try to take that away from you as you grow and to fight at the teeth of your enemies defenses and to claim victory is always satisfying even if its just a fight in the alley and fight the nether will be a living hell your a walk in the park as you gain a understanding of the world and why it is this way as you either live as kings or die trying as you scavenging your way to the top taking your foes with you for your people so they can progress farther as you lie bleeding to death as you feel every inch of your life slipping away from you as all you worked for escapes from you in a second as the PVP and PVE gameplay is unique in its own way as the community come together on PVE but if you want the true and classic feeling of nether and feeling any second you will be hunted down and executed or to be eaten alive then PVP is for you but over all the game is a master piece in its own way but that is dependent on the players play style and if they are willing to discover and be dedicated to this world in a way or another as you will realizes how truly fun Nether is as you can play alone or with friends or find new friends in the safe zone but as you will learn quickly no where is safe as you explore Nether.

number of helpful: 13 of 24 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												I do not see the problem people are having with this game. The community will slaughter you at first sight, yes. But if you actually ask around you'll see  that there are a few people who'll help you.I'll describe the joy I've had with this game in the 4 hours I've played:I joined a EU-West server, and to my suprise people were actually typing in ENGLISH. DECENT ENGLISH (I shouldn't even complain, my grammar is wayyyy off the map).Surely did I  taste the wrath of veterans killing me and I'll admit it, I wanted to quit the game so hard. But I stayed, which I'm glad I did.After that I ended up socialising with a few of the guys which instantly made me a friendly target. No ONE, and I repeat, NO ONE was even trying to kill me after I explained that I was just a new player wanting to learn the game.I ended up becomming friends with a player called W4R which took his time to give me resources and show me a few tricks.This proved to me that the community is actually what YOU choose it to be. If you decide not to talk with your fellow players they'll surely see you as a potential danger. But if you actually take your time to ask them questions and such they'll just see you as a friendly guy trying to learn the game.Sadly, there were still some people which acussed skilled players of being hackers. Which they obviously weren't.I'll rate the community with 7/10. There's still work to be done.Now, for the actualy gameplay... Oh god. I love that you've tried but come on developers... These monsters are just plain boring and will go down extremly easily. And all of them being able to teleport is just...No.Fighting enemies that constatly teleport around you is EXTREMLY STUPID AND BORING. We want something better! Something that will stand still and take a beating like he's supposed to while still trying to kick my god damn♥♥♥♥♥  So if you're a fan of PVE, then don't buy this game.Don't even consider it.Now, when it comes to PVP... You'll find yourself in TONS of battles.  You can either go lone-wolf and decide to snipe the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of everyone you see or you could start a gang and have a gang war.Make people take off their clothes for you! Make them drom you their items and then execute them! You've got so many opportunities! ( Please do not do this to new players)Bugs. Oh boy does this game have bugs...Oh boyyyyy. Do not buy this game if you can't stand having to jump 50 times to get over an obstacle. Do not buy this game if you're a boring person not willing to see the fun in being able to walk through crates. This game is EXTREMLY buggy. But don't let that scare you, because these bugs WILL all get fixed and right now they're just making the game funnier. It's something you can relay on when you've just been chased by a gang for 2 hours. It will make your day.Gameplay: 7/10.This game has still got so MUCH to fix. But that's what I like. Because I feel like I'm part of it and able to change stuff together with the rest of the community.  So if you want to play a survival game alone/with your friends that you'll surely enjoy... Then this is the one. Overall: 8/10Don't just believe those short negative reviews...Try the game. It's awesome.P.S: Whoever said this was P2W...Did you actually play the game?

But if you look passed the minor flaws, you'll find a fantastic game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								**** DISCLAIMER - Yes I know this is an alpha game and I am a terri-bad player!! Also I get a little long winded in spots! If your attention span can't handle it, don't read!! Hopefully this will help people deciding on buying the game. Number ratings are at the bottom after my long winded parts ;-) ******"A DAYZ Killer" they said in the banner... well as much as I love DAYZ, I had to go research. A survival game the research showed! In a sprawling urban environment with tribes working to capture and hold parts of the city. Ok, so it looked like a more robust end game style, perfect! The videos and screens were of some sort of monsters that I could only guess were mutated zombies of some sort. Well... that'll teach me to do dive too quickly and not read further...So I bought the game. First load in showed the city to be beautiful. A stark setting under a dark sky with strange sounds all around. I hestitantly walked forward 30 feet... bam... dead. Oh it looks like another survivor in this sprawling expanse found me and wanted my butter knife. Ok no prob... respawn... get two blocks and find an axe!! Perfect that wil... bam... dead from behind. Oh... ok. Respawn in the world... 1 minute later... bam... They sure do want their butter knives in this city. Ok so I will respawn in a "safezone". Spawn in... bam bam bam! Oh good, a tribe is camping the safezone during an event where the safezones are not...safezones. Ooookay.... So began the frustration. I did like the character leveling tree, but it's gone as soon as you get killed. Items seem cheesy when you run into them. If you have ever played DAYZ or few of the mods you'll see what I mean. Let me stand perfectly still while I hold the "E" button down to spend four seconds of actual time to pickup a... soda. That doesn't expose me at all in this "survival game". And now the creatures... horrifying... kind of. Relatable? No... Sci-fi-ish? Yes... And that is how this game should have been marketed. They should have never mentioned DAYZ except for purely the money grab to get people all excited to buy it. The creatures are fairly decent models and have great sounds. They also teleport... yup that is right. Flashy light, poof, they are behind you, to your side, etc etc. In a first person game, that makes them a pretty decent threat. Ok... so I am new spawn with a butter knife, I know I can't take on some of these things. I'll run! The game does have a cool stamina bar that as you level your character (don't get killed!), can be beefed up. Problem... the creatures don't need to run. They watch you run like a fool, teleport to you and swing. Ouch... you keep running, they teleport again, poof, swing aaaaand your dead. And I tested it... it doesn't matter if you jump over things, try to lose them in a building, etc. They WILL find you. So that means no running. Ok I will swing with them with my butter knife! Boom health points start to drop on you rapidly. One or two confrontations and you are smoked. Creature mechanics... ='s bad.... especially when players are taking you out with a few swings of their melee weapons.In game stores... this is kind of neat. An end of the world shop area where people trade you for things you find. Cigarettes etc. This makes it so you can get currency that allows you to buy a little better gear. Just don't get caught here when the safezone nether devices fail. Tribes camp people here... not creatures... why? Darned if I know...In short folks, if you are COD/Battlefielder where you shoot everything on site, this may be a slight distraction.So 6 hours later... here is the first impressionSo for the scales: 1 worst, 10 bestCharacter Control: 7 (I liked the jumping, was fairly smooth, but dropped it a point due to not being able to side step when sprinting)Weapons: 7 (when you can get them, they are fairly cool)Graphics: 7 (dropped this due to the item graphics and flashing, makes for no real searching like in other games. Just run around looking for the flashes/glowing to find things to search)Creature/NPC: 6 (superbad mechanics for newbies - other players are bad enough to deal with)Leveling: 7 (I liked the idea of the tree leveling - but it lost it's flair when I realized how fast you lose it)Crafting: 5 (interestingly enough you find pieces of things to piece together back at the safe zone. But holy heck... give me a weapon I can actually use seeing as a person can get killed every minute by creatures or players. Pick a low pop server at first folks if you want even a chance of trying this out!)UI: 5 (rudimentary UI, with a decent map waypoint system. Horrible settings/config. It doesn't even show all the key bindings but will holler at you if you try to remap something that is already bound)Ingame Chat/Voice: 4 (I never found a way to have a local/area chat so anything you say goes straight to global/largescale area. Better not plan a tribe take over in that! The voice chat was fairly horrible the few seconds I heard someone try it.)Community: 1 (yup a 1... better bring some friends if you are serious about trying this)Clan/Tribe Activity: 4 (you can take over area's of the city. I went to area's that said they were unclaimed and was told that I had to stand in a certain area for five minutes. Supposedly a bar would come up that showed my progress. Again, with no basic level info, I went out to forums to find out just this information. No one would say in global or chat. I never did get to claim any area's. Perhaps you have to be a clan, but I never really got to talk to anyone in an attempt to join one. Pretty much anyone that I saw coming, was filling me and my butter knife full of lead...)Grouping/In game event: 6  (I saw some people talking in global chat, and they went and secured some type of objective. It reminded me a little of Defiance and Rift in that aspect. The problem comes from people also going there to shoot you as you try to complete said objectives.)PvP: 8 (If you like the COD/Battlefield style play with a little sci-fi-ish NPC's thrown in, you might like this)Survival Aspect: 4 (The emphasis on this game is killing creatures and players. It feels like the food meter is an after-thought, that adds one more thing in the game that can kill you. Trust me, unless you bring a posse', this will never be a real problem for you. If you come into this game expecting the feel of DAYZ SA, you will not find that here. This survival is based against other players and the creatures which makes it feel just like another CoD/BF4ish game. It's a run and gun... or butter knife...)Storyline: 5 (rudimentary tutorial missions when you first start - IF you can finish them. No over all arching story missions or quests. You have no idea why you are running around trying to kill people other than to just take their stuff)Overall rating: 4.93  (I may try to play it another hour so that I feel I haven't completely wasted my 14.99... but I am not sure if I can bring myself too)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Where do I start... If you're one of the lucky ones, you will be able to buy the game, launch it, and be able to play immediately. (Don't count on it...) I had to throw out SOS to Steam/Nether for their gut-wrenchingly poor support for Steam-Nether account synchonization.Game play, game play... It feels like a really *really* poorly done mod for Fallout or Skyrim... E.G. Guns have incredibly boring accuracy mechanics, and melee combat feels like a mod went poorly, and abandoned by the modder -- out of shame.About 20%~25% of my time is time spent stuck *inside the environment*... Inconspicous walls seem to like to grab characters, and never let them go. Not to mention the half dozen areas that should be "inaccessible" to players, having no real way out... Other than to starve to death, or get mauled by monsters... Which, by the way, means you lose all your stuff (with no chance of getting them back, lest you get stuck in the inaccessible area again...)The monsters... Probably some of the most, grotesquely boring enemies I've ever experienced in any format of FPS... Probably equipped with the most tragic sense of AI that's ever disgraced the visage of mankind, with even a speck of paying attention you should be able to tell exactly where the monster is going, and what attack it's going to do LOOOONG before it'll touch you.Player VS. Environment VS. PlayerGreat concept on paper, but when applied... You only get players who rally up, and camp the buildings and kill you on a whim... Which is totally popular, and legitimate tactic for PVP games... But but for an adventure/survival/exploration/PVP -- it's just a really poorly mish-mash of concepts that are easily dismissed to make it into an entirely PVP game, with basically less-than-spectacular weapon and combat mechanics.Occasionally character stops sprinting, mid-sprint... Standing there as an open target for whatever nasty beast is drooling after you, or player is trying to kill you.I made a point to test my theories in PVE, and successfully killed every monster the game had to offer with the basic starter knife... No. I am not a pro at this game, no it was not epic, it was all actually really depressing, and disappointing...So... With pathetically done environment, extremely lack-luster PVP, monsters that make Rust Bears/Wolves look like IQ-Over-9000 (minus erratic teleporting, which is still quite unimpressive...) and well. All-around lack of content and an otherwise undesirable atmosphere for a game... Not to mention the HUD/social/communications in this game is just... Atrocious...The character customization offers a massive variety of everything between Vanilla, to... Well. Vanilla.   If you spend money, you might get a single M&M to put on top of it... But they will only provide the color/flavor you don't like.This isn't even half of the stuff I want to say about this game... But I think the point has been made.Buy something else...Play something else...Don't waste your time on this like I did.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Go spend your hard earned money on anything else but this.   I thought it was worth the risk for a very reasonable price and bought it during the summer sale.  First, making an account was attrocious work, due to NOT recieving any validation email, no matter how many times I attempted to make their "website" do so with the "verify" button in your account settings. Strangely I was able to start the game without a verification email... ok, strange.   When the client starts, you are not greeted with a title screen, or any kind of story... no.  You are greeted with a server screen that takes about 5 minutes to load until you can do ANYTHING! No, I am not exagerating, this server screen takes your mouse icon as a hostage until it is done loading so you cannot even close the game if you want to.  Finally! I select a server and in I go right?  I get to select a character, spawn, check my graphic settings, maybe I might actually SEE some of the game... right?  Nope!  The game shows you a big middle finger by spawning you somewhere on the map in spectator mode, WITHOUT the ability to open the options menu to check your graphics, or even CHAT with the populous already playing the game.  This leaves you with your only option of flying around as a disembodied entity watching the world around you just.... be there.  Angrily I decide to end the game.... but how?  The options menu doesnt even pop up! The game took my options menu hostage!  Alright, so I have to resort to some brute force and just close the game using the task manager to get back to windows.  But I still want to actually TRY this game I payed for, in order to form an opinion right?  Ok, I am fair, maybe this is still in Beta testing (though it is NOT in any way mentioned when you buy it in Steam that this is the case), and maybe it is a bug.  I write an email to the support and explain the situation.  One day later, I look in my mailbox and only get an email that says "thank you for purchasing the game!".  If YOU have better things to do with your time then to let this poorly developed skeleton of a software gnaw at your sanity, then spend a couple bucks more and buy ANYTHING else, and enjoy THAT instead!

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Don't get this game, just don't. I put it on my wishlist hoping it would eventually go from alpha to beta then full game where I'd eventually buy it (I'm not paying full price for a half finished game). Then the Summer sale comes along and nether drops to $2.99 and there is no sign of an alpha or even a beta tag on their main page, an obvious trick to get people to purchase a game that is clearly not ready, but forget about that nonsense. Here we go on an adventure! Time to make my character, wow there really seem to be a lot of choices, or atleast there would be if you want to spend more real world money to unlock anything other than a red shirt and khakis. Oh well, pick one of three hairless heads and lets be on our way! Spawn in a safezone, that sounds like the best idea, as I have no idea what I'm doing yet. Cool there's other people here too! Heh that's awkward those to guys look a lot alike....and I guess I also look just the same, I knew I should have picked the black guy head. Ok well, lets start playing the game. Don't let the name safezone fool you for it's actually the most dangerous part of the whole map! Make sure to find and turn on the anti nether devices! What's that you say? You just started and we haven't told you about the anti nether devices protecting the safezone? Well it's too late for that! There's nowhere to hide as monsters swoop in and teleport all around as you flail helplessly and die as the faint sound of a toilet flushing hits the back of your mind and you think of all the other ways you could have spent your money. Spawn again and this time I'm Super far away from the safezone. Well if that was the safezone I'd hate to see what it's like out here and with the sun going down no less, I'm sure nothing creepy is going to happen after dark. Turns out that's just the case as nothing attacks me as I walk through empty building after empty building with not even a pile of trash to search through, when finally I spot a glowing box that I can finally search. What's that? It should open an inventory window once you've searched it to grab the items like every game has been doing since the dawn of time? F*** that we're going to randomly throw it on the ground next to the pile so you can search that pile. A can of beans and a shotgun barrel! The gods have surely smiled on me this day! I am indeed  hungry as I eat the can of beans and begin the rest of the walk towards the safezone where i can find the local purveyor of fine goods and maybe sell it for more beans. No more than halfway down the block and I'm hungry again and starving to death. I reach the safezone exhausted as I run up to the store shotgun barrel in my hand as I dream of beans, but when I interact with the vendor apparently he'll only buy the shotgun barrel if I have other random stuff with it. "What an odd fellow!" I think as my lifeless body hits the floor dead from starvation only 10 minutes out from downing a whole can of beans. Cool! Well I'll respawn just in time to see my fellow survivors allready cleaning my corpse of all his valuables. Back to square one. Look at how much fun we're having!Problems:   Non-safe, safezones   Nothing to do other than walk packages back and forth between "safezones"   Nothing to do out in the wasteland but scavenge the 3 lootable items on the whole island   Monsters teleport behind you as soon as you try to attack and grab you from behind and then repeat   My gear doesn't save even if I log out, instead of dying, ensuring that I never make any progress    Tutorial?   Wierd system to buy and sell goods.   Everything elseCalling this game an alpha build is an insult to every alpha that's ever existed and not labeling it as an unfinshed game on you page is downright underhanded. I really do want to see this game succeed as it has good concepts in place, but it is just so far from the end product that they promise that it'll be a long time before you see anything worth it on this game. Check back in a year maybe it'll be worth a buy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Disenfranchised players, hackers galore, and a distant development crew who do not listen to their player base. Welcome to nether where 5 hours of hard work can be wiped out completely by one cheater with godmode and aimbot. Do the developers care? Read their updates and "news" posts. Any mention of cracking down on cheating programs, activating an anti-cheat program, anything to stop that? Nope. next lets talk about game play and plot. Gameplay is ok in the sense that you can run around pretty much willy-nilly without worrying too much. The in game "nethers" will spawn weak and ultra-strong versions with no consideration for player level (+1 for zombie apocolypse realism). They will spawn in your spawn points after you die, they invade the "safe zones" and kill you there, only to have you respawn halfway across the map so that by the time you get back to your body it has already been looted or decayed (You will really needs some good friends to play with you if you want to keep your stuff after death). And all that experience and character boosting you did? Forget about it, it is gone. Next, if you want the really good stuff in the game, be ready to shell out some real money. Because it only spawns in locked containers that you have to buy keys for with cold hard real world cash. And even then you aren't garanteed anything worthwhile. Finally plot. Nothing there. Nada. Zilch. Zippo. Quests primarily involve "Run this package there" or "Get these different items and come back here." All the while nethers and cheaters are out to kill you.TL;DR? Be prepared to have a lot of work canceled by cheaters, you are never really safe anywhere, to get the good stuff you have to spend more real world money, and you are wasting your time if you expect anything resembling a storyline.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												Nether is, obviously, still a work in progress, but I would hold off on getting it if I were you.  Most of the gameplay consists of getting completely dissoriented and unbearably lost until somebody one-shots you from out of nowhere.  There's no chance to defend yourself or even duck in cover because the creators aspired for the game to be so "realistic" that pistol bullets do 87% of your health per shot, and the only way to survive is to destroy fellow humanity around you and kill other players, which is infuriating to freshly spawned players that can't even get to a safezone before getting sniped.  On top of all of this, upon death, you lose all of your non-aparrel items and a good chunk of cash, plus all of your player levels and skill points.  This discourages the hard work you put towards gaining all of this, including spending extra money, and there's absolutely nothing you can do about it if someone decides to be a paranoid prick and pull the trigger.  Until the game is rebalanced, segregated for separate PvE/PvP servers, and more focused on surviving the Nether onslaught rather than hiding in the safezone because you're afraid you'll be shot the second you step outside, don't play this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								**** DISCLAIMER - Yes I know this is an alpha game and I am a terri-bad player!! Also I get a little long winded in spots! If your attention span can't handle it, don't read!! Hopefully this will help people deciding on buying the game. Number ratings are at the bottom after my long winded parts ;-) ******"A DAYZ Killer" they said in the banner... well as much as I love DAYZ, I had to go research. A survival game the research showed! In a sprawling urban environment with tribes working to capture and hold parts of the city. Ok, so it looked like a more robust end game style, perfect! The videos and screens were of some sort of monsters that I could only guess were mutated zombies of some sort. Well... that'll teach me to do dive too quickly and not read further...So I bought the game. First load in showed the city to be beautiful. A stark setting under a dark sky with strange sounds all around. I hestitantly walked forward 30 feet... bam... dead. Oh it looks like another survivor in this sprawling expanse found me and wanted my butter knife. Ok no prob... respawn... get two blocks and find an axe!! Perfect that wil... bam... dead from behind. Oh... ok. Respawn in the world... 1 minute later... bam... They sure do want their butter knives in this city. Ok so I will respawn in a "safezone". Spawn in... bam bam bam! Oh good, a tribe is camping the safezone during an event where the safezones are not...safezones. Ooookay.... So began the frustration. I did like the character leveling tree, but it's gone as soon as you get killed. Items seem cheesy when you run into them. If you have ever played DAYZ or few of the mods you'll see what I mean. Let me stand perfectly still while I hold the "E" button down to spend four seconds of actual time to pickup a... soda. That doesn't expose me at all in this "survival game". And now the creatures... horrifying... kind of. Relatable? No... Sci-fi-ish? Yes... And that is how this game should have been marketed. They should have never mentioned DAYZ except for purely the money grab to get people all excited to buy it. The creatures are fairly decent models and have great sounds. They also teleport... yup that is right. Flashy light, poof, they are behind you, to your side, etc etc. In a first person game, that makes them a pretty decent threat. Ok... so I am new spawn with a butter knife, I know I can't take on some of these things. I'll run! The game does have a cool stamina bar that as you level your character (don't get killed!), can be beefed up. Problem... the creatures don't need to run. They watch you run like a fool, teleport to you and swing. Ouch... you keep running, they teleport again, poof, swing aaaaand your dead. And I tested it... it doesn't matter if you jump over things, try to lose them in a building, etc. They WILL find you. So that means no running. Ok I will swing with them with my butter knife! Boom health points start to drop on you rapidly. One or two confrontations and you are smoked. Creature mechanics... ='s bad.... especially when players are taking you out with a few swings of their melee weapons.In game stores... this is kind of neat. An end of the world shop area where people trade you for things you find. Cigarettes etc. This makes it so you can get currency that allows you to buy a little better gear. Just don't get caught here when the safezone nether devices fail. Tribes camp people here... not creatures... why? Darned if I know...In short folks, if you are COD/Battlefielder where you shoot everything on site, this may be a slight distraction.So 6 hours later... here is the first impressionSo for the scales: 1 worst, 10 bestCharacter Control: 7 (I liked the jumping, was fairly smooth, but dropped it a point due to not being able to side step when sprinting)Weapons: 7 (when you can get them, they are fairly cool)Graphics: 7 (dropped this due to the item graphics and flashing, makes for no real searching like in other games. Just run around looking for the flashes/glowing to find things to search)Creature/NPC: 6 (superbad mechanics for newbies - other players are bad enough to deal with)Leveling: 7 (I liked the idea of the tree leveling - but it lost it's flair when I realized how fast you lose it)Crafting: 5 (interestingly enough you find pieces of things to piece together back at the safe zone. But holy heck... give me a weapon I can actually use seeing as a person can get killed every minute by creatures or players. Pick a low pop server at first folks if you want even a chance of trying this out!)UI: 5 (rudimentary UI, with a decent map waypoint system. Horrible settings/config. It doesn't even show all the key bindings but will holler at you if you try to remap something that is already bound)Ingame Chat/Voice: 4 (I never found a way to have a local/area chat so anything you say goes straight to global/largescale area. Better not plan a tribe take over in that! The voice chat was fairly horrible the few seconds I heard someone try it.)Community: 1 (yup a 1... better bring some friends if you are serious about trying this)Clan/Tribe Activity: 4 (you can take over area's of the city. I went to area's that said they were unclaimed and was told that I had to stand in a certain area for five minutes. Supposedly a bar would come up that showed my progress. Again, with no basic level info, I went out to forums to find out just this information. No one would say in global or chat. I never did get to claim any area's. Perhaps you have to be a clan, but I never really got to talk to anyone in an attempt to join one. Pretty much anyone that I saw coming, was filling me and my butter knife full of lead...)Grouping/In game event: 6  (I saw some people talking in global chat, and they went and secured some type of objective. It reminded me a little of Defiance and Rift in that aspect. The problem comes from people also going there to shoot you as you try to complete said objectives.)PvP: 8 (If you like the COD/Battlefield style play with a little sci-fi-ish NPC's thrown in, you might like this)Survival Aspect: 4 (The emphasis on this game is killing creatures and players. It feels like the food meter is an after-thought, that adds one more thing in the game that can kill you. Trust me, unless you bring a posse', this will never be a real problem for you. If you come into this game expecting the feel of DAYZ SA, you will not find that here. This survival is based against other players and the creatures which makes it feel just like another CoD/BF4ish game. It's a run and gun... or butter knife...)Storyline: 5 (rudimentary tutorial missions when you first start - IF you can finish them. No over all arching story missions or quests. You have no idea why you are running around trying to kill people other than to just take their stuff)Overall rating: 4.93  (I may try to play it another hour so that I feel I haven't completely wasted my 14.99... but I am not sure if I can bring myself too)

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												P.O.S Game. I generally dont really critique games. However this is just utter garbage.I got the game on sale 80% off. So i paid 3 bucks. Even then i wish i could get that money back. I feel dirty patronizing these people one way or another.The game is broken. Plain and simple. Most 'solid objects' you can easilly pass through. Including the ground, Trees, and Houses.You can also sink through the ground if your trying to swim in water. There is no swimming capabilites at all, which makes roughlly half of the map unplayable.The game also feels very baren and downright boring. There is nothing much to do other then fight 'nether' (which are essentially gigantic teleporting mutants), who have terrible AI pathfinding. It is very easy to just go around a corner, and get the enemy AI stuck.You can easilly kill enemies THROUGH WALLS. And not even with a gun. A knife can cut through a wall and kill an enemy. Due to its model clipping through the wall. You can easilly take out huge baddies using this. Though obviouslly exploitable, this hole game is just full of game holes.The worst about the game is the fact it does not even function most of the time. The game tends to simply not run. It will generally freeze on the server loading screen. Where the developers say the only way to get the game to work is to sit patientlly staring at the frozen screen for around 5 minutes. Alt tabbing or Ctrl Alt Deleting to check if its running will crash it.The game also likes to crash on its launcher which seems to have been done using VB with almost no help and no pre launch game options avalible to you.The game will also crash randomlly after 20 minutes to an hour. Even with a great gaming rig. The game also when it DOES play will also have at best 30 FPS. The game also likes to generally crash on loading into a server.The modeling for the characters and NPC's is dreadful and lackluster. The world looks boring and dated.The hole game is dull and an outright waste of time. Even if this was a free to play game i would scream avoid like the plague.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												I have held off writing this review for a variety of reason, most of which I will address but I want to begin by saying that at its core, Nether is a fun game. A vast, beautiful world that although seemingly barren is jammed full of things to explore. The possibility for looting is everywhere and the nether that inhabit the city make for fun opponents if not the most challenging (this is of course after getting a few guns, otherwise you’re in for a rough time). By far the biggest impact of the game comes from the player base and how you come to interact with it. I started off by reading a bit and prepared for the usual spawn campers that inhabit all survival games. The first 5 hours of gameplay were terrible and I am sorry but there is no other way to put it. A combination of the fore mentioned spawn campers and lack of gear resulted in countless deaths for no gain. Eventually though you will survive enough runs between safe zones to get a small stockpile of weapons and ammo which gives you a few options, continue exploring deeper into the city, collecting as you go or become that which is hated by entering the pseudo pvp. I call it that because there is no give or take by investing in the melee tree, you have a gun or you die and even then you will still die but only to other gun holders. Sadly this game seems to center too much on murdering other players for their stuff. I am about 20 hours into the game and although there are servers where people will work together and explore this possibly great game, for the most part it’s just people who get their rocks off by spawn camping. I have read that a pve environment may be in the works but unless the AI is improved then that will be the ultimate care bear of this game (making courier package runs is reasonably easy already minus the players that snipe everyone entering or leaving a safe zone). So the long and short of my review comes to this, Nether is a fantastic idea that with enough time and tweaking could have been the fallout mmo that some gamers like myself have been waiting for, but  a combination of in-game bugs which ranged from my flashlight never turning on to ramps and platforms not actually being between building so all you get is a nice 50 foot death fall, as well as a dimwitted AI and terrible player base which are trapped in the "I am l33t you are n00b" mentality ruin this game for continued play. As I said before I held off reviewing this because I wanted very much to enjoy it with seemingly small problems ruining my experience. Unfortunately the slow development cycle, player base, and almost laughable enemy AI have finally pushed the game past the point of enjoyment. It is a chore to find playable servers with minimal bugs and players that have more social skills than road kill. I wish the developers the best because there is a solid idea here but it needs a lot of work. 4.5/10

												When the steam sale came around, and I saw this game, I was very excited. I really wanted a great survival game to play online that i could really sink my teeth into. Unfortunately, I've giving up on that game being Nether. The first thing I've noticed is the time it takes to get a game started; It takes a while to even spawn. Ok, I can get through that if the gameplay is gripping. Once you do spawn you're given a brief explanation of how/where to buy things, what tribes are & how to join them, and then sort of set loose.Running around the world is pretty amusing, but I lacked the little bit of guidance I needed to get care about the world of the game. I know a lot of people feel duped, becasue this game feels unfinished. Framerate issues are common, and starting over from your many, many, deaths feels like a chore rather than a new adventure.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												What a huge wase of time and money.  This is an unmitigated failure of a game.  I get that this is post apacalypse and it is supposed to be a hard life, but come on.The autolauncer want me to sign up for their service...It fails.  Google tells me that I am not the only one, I go to the company's website and sign up there.  That works OK.graphically the game is OK, muddy and drab,  but it does not run very well.  even on the lowest settings.  Reminds me of Fallout 3, but without the quality control.  you will get stuck every so often on some piece of landscape until the game generously vomits you forth into clear terrain.  I wish I had something to positive to say about this.  Hmmm, I guess the sound is well done.  1.  Game started me out in a safe zone...Wow, apparently the safe zones are randomly unsafe.  First three characters died within 15 feet of thier starting point, swarmed by teleporting mobs with nothing to defend myself but a kitchen knife.  2.  1 person tried to help me, but he was swamped by a hoard as well.  3.  Finally someone secures the safe zone and I randomly stumble upon some package that it tells me to deliver somewhere, but does not indicate where I have to go.  (I'm guessing you have to really know the maps)  agian stumbled into the right place and was able to turn in the package to get a reward.    then I was given a quest to deliver something outside the zone.  I get 80% of the way there and hear a ping sound and my character falls dead.  I can only assume someone I could not see shot me.  4.  I try again, this time trying to be stealthy.  But this time I don't have the benefit of my prior turn in.  I start out a squeeker again.  OK,  this time I get trounced by mobs.5.  Again.  Someone takes me out with a shotgun6.  I opt to spawn in the wilderness.  Find a beeping box that apparently I have to bring somewhere...Not that I can tell where I have to bring it, so I try to head to home base.  The box takes both hands.  So I can't defend myself...Can't find a way to quickly driop it so I run.  I get within visual distance of the base (after 5 minutes of frenzied pursuit) onlt to be shot, I guess so someone at a higher level won't have to be bothered with walking so far.  This game might be more fun if they had some way to ease into the game or some kind of tutorial or a better hud that allowed you to pinpoint where you had to go (oh, they do let you make waypoints, but all that does it put a little tick on the compass rose and that feature sucks for finding your way around).  Or a better map, or less clipping, or smoother graphics, or a less brutal starting point or a reasonalby reliable way for you to escape predatory PVP trolls. The servers are too small to allow for a robust community to defend Noobs.  there just are not enough people.  Even if there were, they would have no reason too. I see no fun in this game, nor do I see any future.  If this were an Alpha build but no, perhaps if they were do form a new server so that new people stood a chance in the world.  I'll try it agin in a few weeks, but I'm going to chalk this one up to Caveat Emptor.

content:

content:

												Well I spent the first four days just trying to get into a server. I run more graphic intesive games requiring higher bandwidth so its not my rig. After you wait for the ungodly amount of time required to actually get the servers list to respond you will be met with the highly unintuitive list of servers. Dont bother trying to sort it, the list is in the order the devs want it to be in and the rest of us can just ♥♥♥♥ off. Once you actually get into a game, which should be a Steam Achievment all by itself, you are immediately met with two scenarios: You are instantly gang♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by  a bunch of monsters, or, you are instantly sniped by another player camping the spawn zone. But lets say you escape the spawn zone with your hide intact. Try not attack any monsters when near rocks...or trees...or buildings.......or ANYTHING that they might clip into when doing their riddiculous teleportation dance, because it will make your game crash. Spend your money on DayZ.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												I play games here and there and I can say that Nether is made only for those who are into serious PvP and hardmode FPS games. For someone like me who doesn't really commit to any particular game, this game is impossible. Nethers aggro very easily and you lose all of your equipment when you die. On top of that other players will 99% try to kill you to loot your weapons, ammo and healing items. Yes, you get a chance to recover your dropped items when you die, but if you happen to die far from a spawn point then tough luck, chances are, you'll either die again on your way there from nethers or other player OR your dropped items have already despawned. very frustrating when you have spent the last 2 hours farming to get a weapon and lose it the next minute.Also, this game is not for people who likes to play solo. you will get swarmed by either nethers or other players. so if you will get this game even after reading this review, better make sure you join a tribe.So nether would be an amazing game for people who are totally into PvP FPS. But it is definitely not for me, I would rather play something that would give me less challenge but allow me to explore the world without dying every 15 minutes and lose all of my gear.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Terrible. Just terrible.I'm a huge fan of post-apocalyptic games. Anything from L4D, DayZ, RFG, and just about anything of the sort gets me going and excited for the playing of it. I was looking at Nether for a while. I finally had enough to swing the medium pack and get playing, which was hard enough to swing the money. I was super excited, but it was one of the biggest mistakes I've ever made.The game requires an other-than-steam account, which besides Origin, I truly despise. (ABP: Reloaded for example) And signals a glitchy, popy, irradicated, unsatisfactory gameplay. (At least with my experience.) The game took forever to "verify" my account, and failed ~12 times. When I was able to finally get on, I attempted to start into a server. The game froze at the server screen and I had to restart 3 times to get the servers screen to work. Finally, it was EXSCRUTIATING to find a server with people in  it. When I finally joined, I only had a knife. I know games want you to have a slight start up, but this took FOREVER with no action at all. When I finally left the designated "Safe Zone" there was nothing to loot. Nothing. No guns, no weaponry, no armor, no working vehicles, nothing. I ran around with a crowbar and hit a few buildings when I decided enough.Finally, I went back into the safe zone to find out that the Nethers were in there causing chaos with the new players there. Nothing could be done and we were fending off 8 foot tall monstrosities with butter knives.After 5 consecutive deaths, I called it quits.0/10, never playing again. The first time I ever REALLY wished I could get a refund for a game. It took me 8 days to get that 6$ usd and I regret spending it on this TERRIBLE game. Don't buy it. I sent my friend a 72 hour pass since it was on his wish list.He took it off 30 minutes later. I'm extremely dissapointed. I expect Steam to filter out junk like this. I've since then lowered my standards.

It's not very fun to run around for 45 minutes trying to find a gun only to get killed, respawn, and do it again.And in the rare occassion you do get a gun?  You'll probably be killed. content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												If you're buying it during the Steam sale for $5 and just want to know if it's stable enough to be worth playing based on recent reviews, for me the process of creating an account and logging in was painless, as was my first hour or so of playtime, other than a few minor bugs (none that crashed game yet). There's a lot I've run into that seems inspired by the STALKER series, but the most immediate connection to me is the environment, which feels alive, gorgeous and terrifying in the same way. Hurrying from building to building feels sort of like being an insect - stay out of sight in whatever dark spaces you can find, and hope that you don't get stepped on.
